repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Transport Sector Adjustment /
            Investment Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, sustainability is likely, with modest
            institutional development impacts. Lessons drawn from the
            project, focus mainly on the achievements of the sector
            programs, their benefits, strengths and weaknesses.
            Experience points at the high cost, and time consuming
            preparation of sector programs, whose full attention is
            basically on policy reform. Taking this into account, and
            while policy dialogue may be strong during program
            preparation, the implementation of the investment component
            following the program is obviously the driving force, which,
            once the program is established, key policy dialogues tend
            to fade away, weakening donor coordination, to resume,
            probably, for the preparation of a follow-up program, if
            any. Thus, the strong continuity in policy dialogue would be
            instrumental in pursuing sector efficiency, performance, and
            reforms, if supported by government ownership, and local
            capacity building. Additionally, the preparation of
            investment programs within transport sector programs, should
            be integrated within the process of preparing annual public
            expenditure programs, to ensure appropriate revisions later
            on, and, the program scope, and objectives should be also
            reviewed annually, to reflect the realistic financial availability.

repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Transport Sector Adjustment -
            Investment Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will assist the Government
            in rehabilitating and maintaining essential transport
            infrastructure and in improving sectoral efficiency,
            including the strengthening of existing institutions as well
            as the adoption of sound policy and regulatory measures.
            The project covers the priority areas of the
            Government's FY91-FY95 total sectoral expenditure
            program.  The program places particular emphasis on road
            maintenance, including reliable counterpart funding and
            institutional improvements, and selective road
            rehabilitation of national, regional, and departmental
            roads.  The project also includes road safety improvements.
            The railway component covers essential track maintenance and
            a contract plan to improve management autonomy and
            efficiency.  The port component focusses on implementation
            of the remaining tasks under the operational and financial
            action plan and on improved road/rail access to the new
            container terminal and rehabilitation of dilapidated utility
            networks.  The civil aviation component includes
            rehabilitation to essential safety standards to the Cap
            Skirring and Ziguinchor runways, and assistance to financial
            and operational action plans for AIR SENEGAL and the Agency
            for Air Navigation Safety - Senegal. Additionally, the
            project will finance technical assistance for management
            support and training, and for the implementation of agreed
            policy actions in the sector.
